subject: p15259244
History: -year-old immunosuppressed patient with increasing productive cough with associated hemoptysis, evaluate for interval change. Comparison is made to the patients previous study dated at 5:1 Portable AP upright chest film, at 13:17 is submitted.
Impression: Right internal jugular dialysis catheter again having its tip within the right atrium in similar position as compared to multiple prior studies. There is increasing bibasilar and perihilar airspace opacities, which likely reflect worsening moderate pulmonary edema. There are likely layering effusions, left greater than right. Diffuse pneumonia would be less likely given the rapidity of interval change. No pneumothorax is seen. Overall, cardiac and mediastinal contours are unchanged, with the heart being stably enlarged.
